items.title: Search for Charlie Kirk's killer continues. Here's what we know.
items.standfirst: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk was shot and killed on Wednesday while speaking an event at Utah Valley University. Authorities have not identified a suspect.
items.content: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk was shot and killed on Wednesday while speaking an event at Utah Valley University. Authorities have not identified a suspect.

items.title: Charlie Kirk shooting: Suspect videos, minute by minute
items.standfirst: The FBI released a video Thursday showing who they believe to be the suspect in the killing of US right-wing influencer and key Trump ally Charlie Kirk. France 24's Observers team have taken a detailed look at the footage, which shows the suspect running along a rooftop before dropping to the ground and escaping.
items.content: The FBI released a video Thursday showing who they believe to be the suspect in the killing of US right-wing influencer and key Trump ally Charlie Kirk. France 24's Observers team have taken a detailed look at the footage, which shows the suspect running along a rooftop before dropping to the ground and escaping.

items.title: FBI release clip of Charlie Kirk's suspected shooter escaping

items.content: FBI released surveillance camera footage showing what they said was the moment Charlie Kirk's gunman ran away on Wednesday, after carrying out the deadly shooting of the 31-year-old influential conservative activist and close ally of US President Donald Trump.

clusters.title: Bolsonaro verdict: 'The battleground now will be in Brazil's Congress'
clusters.neutral_headline: Bolsonaro Sentenced to Prison for Coup Plotting in Brazil
bullet_summary: The former president of Brazil has been sentenced to 27 years in prison after being found guilty for plotting a military coup
The former president has been found guilty of trying to mount coup to cling to power after he lost the election
Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro, the far-right politician who governed Brazil between 2019 and 2022, was found guilty on five counts

items.title: Bolsonaro verdict: 'The battleground now will be in Brazil's Congress'
items.standfirst: After Brazil's Supreme Court on Thursday sentenced firebrand ex-president Jair Bolsonaro to 27 years in prison for coup plotting at the end of a landmark trial, the battle will now move to Brazil's Congress, says France 24 correspondent Tim Vickery, where the right wing are “formulating a project for an amnesty”.
items.content: After Brazil's Supreme Court on Thursday sentenced firebrand ex-president Jair Bolsonaro to 27 years in prison for coup plotting at the end of a landmark trial, the battle will now move to Brazil's Congress, says France 24 correspondent Tim Vickery, where the right wing are “formulating a project for an amnesty”.

items.title: What next after Brazil's Bolsonaro given 27-year term for coup plotting?
items.standfirst: Brazil's former President Jair Bolsonaro has been convicted of attempting a coup to stay in office after losing his re-election bid in 2022, becoming the first former president found guilty of trying to overturn an election in the country with the largest economy in Latin America. France 24's Andrew Hilliar takes a look at the significance of the verdict and some of the reaction to it.
items.content: Brazil's former President Jair Bolsonaro has been convicted of attempting a coup to stay in office after losing his re-election bid in 2022, becoming the first former president found guilty of trying to overturn an election in the country with the largest economy in Latin America. France 24's Andrew Hilliar takes a look at the significance of the verdict and some of the reaction to it.

items.title: What you need to know about Bolsonaro's coup prison sentence
items.standfirst: The former president of Brazil has been sentenced to 27 years in prison after being found guilty for plotting a military coup.
items.content: The former president of Brazil has been sentenced to 27 years in prison after being found guilty for plotting a military coup.

items.title: Bolsonaro sentenced to 27 years in prison for plotting Brazil coup
items.standfirst: The former president has been found guilty of trying to mount coup to cling to power after he lost the election.
items.content: The former president has been found guilty of trying to mount coup to cling to power after he lost the election.

items.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro sentenced to 27 years after being convicted of coup attempt
items.standfirst: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro, the far-right politician who governed Brazil between 2019 and 2022, was found guilty on five counts.
items.content: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro, the far-right politician who governed Brazil between 2019 and 2022, was found guilty on five counts.

items.title: Brazilian Supreme Court panel sentences Bolsonaro to more than 27 years in prison
Bolsonaro sentenced to 27 years for plotting military coup in Brazil
items.standfirst: Former president sought to ‘annihilate’ country’s democracy after losing 2022 electionExplainer: what did Bolsonaro’s trial reveal?​Brazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro ​has been sentenced to more than 27 years in prison for plotting a military coup​ and seeking to “annihilate” the South American country’s democracy.Justices Cármen Lúcia Antunes Rocha and Cristiano Zanin ruled on ​Thursday that Bolsonaro – a former paratrooper who was elected president in 2018 – was guilty of seeking to forcibly cling to power after losing the 2022 election, meaning four of the five judges involved in the trial had found Brazil’s former leader guilty. Continue reading...
items.content: Former president sought to ‘annihilate’ country’s democracy after losing 2022 electionExplainer: what did Bolsonaro’s trial reveal?​Brazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro ​has been sentenced to more than 27 years in prison for plotting a military coup​ and seeking to “annihilate” the South American country’s democracy.Justices Cármen Lúcia Antunes Rocha and Cristiano Zanin ruled on ​Thursday that Bolsonaro – a former paratrooper who was elected president in 2018 – was guilty of seeking to forcibly cling to power after losing the 2022 election, meaning four of the five judges involved in the trial had found Brazil’s former leader guilty. Continue reading...

items.title: What did Jair Bolsonaro’s trial reveal about an attempted coup in Brazil?
items.standfirst: Far-right ex-president was found to have led a ‘criminal organisation’ to try to stay in powerBolsonaro found guilty of plotting military coupBrazil’s supreme court has made Jair Bolsonaro the first former president in the country’s history to be convicted for attempting a coup.The 70-year-old far-right leader claims he is the victim of political persecution, but four out of five judges concluded on Thursday that it was sufficiently proven that Bolsonaro and his close allies attempted to overturn the 2022 election, which he lost to Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva. Continue reading...
items.content: Far-right ex-president was found to have led a ‘criminal organisation’ to try to stay in powerBolsonaro found guilty of plotting military coupBrazil’s supreme court has made Jair Bolsonaro the first former president in the country’s history to be convicted for attempting a coup.The 70-year-old far-right leader claims he is the victim of political persecution, but four out of five judges concluded on Thursday that it was sufficiently proven that Bolsonaro and his close allies attempted to overturn the 2022 election, which he lost to Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva. Continue reading...

items.title: Brazil's ex-president sentenced to 27 years in jail - as Trump warns conviction is 'very bad' for country
items.standfirst: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro has been sentenced to 27 years and three months in prison for attempting a coup to stay in power after his 2022 election defeat.
items.content: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro has been sentenced to 27 years and three months in prison for attempting a coup to stay in power after his 2022 election defeat.

ai_summary: Jair Bolsonaro was sentenced to 27 years in prison by Brazil's Supreme Court.
He was found guilty of attempting to overturn the 2022 election results.
The verdict marks the first time a former president has been convicted of this.
The case now shifts to Brazil's Congress, where amnesty is discussed.
Bolsonaro governed Brazil from 2019 to 2022.

items.title: Venezuela says 11 killed in US boat strike were not gang members amid reports vessel was returning to shore
items.standfirst: Interior minister says ‘murder has been committed’ while US Congress demands justification for attackNone of the 11 people killed in a US military strike on a boat in the Caribbean last week were members of Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua, Venezuela’s interior minister has said, while US media reported the attack came after the vessel had turned around and was heading back to shore.The administration of Donald Trump has said the boat was transporting illegal narcotics, but has provided little further information about the incident, even amid demands from members of the US Congress for a justification for the action. Continue reading...
items.content: Interior minister says ‘murder has been committed’ while US Congress demands justification for attackNone of the 11 people killed in a US military strike on a boat in the Caribbean last week were members of Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua, Venezuela’s interior minister has said, while US media reported the attack came after the vessel had turned around and was heading back to shore.The administration of Donald Trump has said the boat was transporting illegal narcotics, but has provided little further information about the incident, even amid demands from members of the US Congress for a justification for the action. items.title: Israel has ‘gone beyond any borders’ with Doha strike, Qatar PM warns UN

clusters.title: OpenAI and Microsoft sketch out deal to unlock for-profit restructuring
clusters.neutral_headline: OpenAI and Microsoft finalize partnership terms
bullet_summary: Reported by Financial Times, Ars Technica News

items.title: OpenAI and Microsoft sketch out deal to unlock for-profit restructuring
items.standfirst: Nonbinding term marks progress in talks to enable ChatGPT maker’s eventual IPO
items.content: Nonbinding term marks progress in talks to enable ChatGPT maker’s eventual IPO

items.title: OpenAI and Microsoft sign preliminary deal to revise partnership terms
items.standfirst: Companies work to finalize terms as OpenAI pursues for-profit restructuring.
items.content: On Thursday, OpenAI and Microsoft announced they have signed a non-binding agreement to revise their partnership, marking the latest development in a relationship that has grown increasingly complex as both companies compete for customers in the AI market and seek new partnerships for growing infrastructure needs. "Microsoft and OpenAI have signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding (MOU) for the next phase of our partnership," the companies wrote in a joint statement. "We are actively working to finalize contractual terms in a definitive agreement. Together, we remain focused on delivering the best AI tools for everyone, grounded in our shared commitment to safety." The announcement comes as OpenAI seeks to restructure from a nonprofit to a for-profit entity, a transition that requires Microsoft's approval, as the company is OpenAI's largest investor with more than $13 billion committed since 2019.Read full article Comments

ai_summary: OpenAI and Microsoft are finalizing terms to revise their partnership.
The nonbinding term marks progress in enabling OpenAI's IPO.
Companies are working to finalize terms as OpenAI pursues restructuring.

items.content: The Federal Trade Commission wants to know more about potential harms to children and teenagers who use their AI chatbots as companions.

items.title: Meta, OpenAI Face FTC Inquiry on Chatbot Impact on Kids

items.content: The Federal Trade Commission ordered Alphabet Inc.’s Google, OpenAI Inc., Meta Platforms Inc. and four other makers of artificial intelligence chatbots to turn over information about the impacts of their technologies on kids.

ai_summary: The Federal Trade Commission is investigating AI chatbot impacts on children.
